decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token. It has disruption in the form of Thoughtseize, Duress, and Abrupt Decay to protect the combo and control the opponent's hand and board. Elvish Reclaimer and Crop Rotation help find the combo pieces efficiently. The deck also runs a small number of creatures like Dark Confidant and Vampire Hexmage for additional utility. The mana base is finely tuned to support the combo while still being able to cast its spells effectively.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to maintain board control through a combination of removal spells, disruption, and powerful planeswalkers. The deck utilizes cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Wrenn and Six, and Tarmogoyf to generate card advantage and control the game. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of versatile spells such as Abrupt Decay, Force of Will, and Brainstorm to deal with threats and protect its own game plan. The mana base is designed to support a range of powerful multicolor spells while also providing access to important utility lands like Wasteland.

The core strategy of this Aggro-Canadian Threshold deck is to apply early pressure on the opponent using efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, while disrupting their game plan with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck aims to control the board by utilizing cards like Stifle and Wasteland to keep the opponent on the back foot. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Lightning Bolt provides additional reach to close out games quickly. Overall, the deck focuses on tempo advantage and efficient threats to secure victories in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The primary focus of this Dragon Stompy deck is to quickly disrupt and control the opponent's mana base using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Trinisphere. This aggro deck aims to lock down the opponent's resources while developing a threatening board presence through cards like Chandra, Torch of Defiance, Goblin Rabblemaster, and Legion Warboss. The deck also includes versatile cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Fiery Confluence to provide additional utility and disruption. With efficient mana acceleration from Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful threats and disruptive elements.

The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp through repeated self-mill effects, allowing for cards like Bridge from Below and Cabal Therapy to be utilized effectively. By utilizing Dredge cards and graveyard recursion, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and graveyard synergies, ultimately leading to a quick victory through a combination of creature and spell recursion. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy while advancing its own game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing various forms of control through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines like Dack Fayden and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wrenn and Six to control the game and generate value over time. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck seeks to control the game, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and eventually win through powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Punishing Fire.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive play through a combination of burn spells and efficient creatures to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. By utilizing a mix of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning alongside creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while utilizing cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish their spells. With a streamlined mana base and low casting cost spells, the deck aims to win quickly and decisively.

The main objective of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Hooting Mandrills, backed up by powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Force of Will. The deck utilizes tempo plays with cards like Daze and Spell Pierce to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. Additionally, the deck has some resilience in the late game with cards like Wrenn and Six and True-Name Nemesis. It aims to control the board early and close out the game aggressively.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, along with disruptive hand disruption spells such as Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Oko, Thief of Crowns to generate card advantage and control the board. With a solid mana base and a mix of threats and answers, this deck aims to grind out games and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful aggressive creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Tarmogoyf, and Gurmag Angler to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze, while also generating value and card advantage through cards like Oko, Thief of Crowns and Wrenn and Six. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color requirements while also incorporating powerful land destruction with Wasteland.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with creatures using cards like Stitcher's Supplier and Faithless Looting, then use cards like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine to bring them back onto the battlefield for a powerful combo finish. With the support of cards like Bridge from Below and Altar of Dementia, you can overwhelm your opponent with a swarm of creatures and quickly close out the game. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in executing its combo strategy to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

This deck focuses on using human creatures with disruptive abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent and control the board. It utilizes cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage to slow down the opponent's strategy while building up a strong board presence with creatures like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant. Cards like Aether Vial and Ancient Ziggurat help to accelerate the deployment of creatures, and Wasteland is used to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck aims to win through aggressive creature attacks and leveraging the synergies between human creatures.

The deck focuses on control through counterspells and removal, utilizing cards like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Council's Judgment to disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to draw cards and generate card advantage with spells like Brainstorm and Accumulated Knowledge, while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and control. With a mix of counter magic, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Legacy format.

The main idea of the deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Faithless Looting, then bring them back into play with Reanimate and Animate Dead. This allows the player to cheat out big threats like Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Ashen Rider early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Unmask and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect its combo pieces.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using lands like Eldrazi Temple, Eye of Ugin, and Cloudpost in order to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Reality Smasher, Thought-Knot Seer, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to control the game and prevent opponents from easily dealing with your threats. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with big creature threats and control elements to quickly end the game in your favor.

This deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond, combined with rituals like Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual. It uses powerful card selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find key combo pieces, while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. The main goal is to cast a high storm count spell like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to win the game in a single explosive turn. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in executing its game plan.
